arm_group.description: Same patients evaluated by two or more health professionals
Tool used for evaluation of patients after surgery
Scored by tool, but not evaluated by it

brief_summary.textblock:
Using clinical experience and "brain storm method" the investigators picked up and
      digitalized information about mental, postoperative nausea, vomiting and pain status at the
      rest and during mobilization in so called Efficacy Side-effect Score (ESS) Depending on
      expression of patient's complaints, all mentioned above clinical features are scored up from
      0 to 10-15 and summarized in the total score. This score is now to be validated and
      re-developed to be used as a tool for improving safety and quality of postoperative care.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy Side-effect Score (ESS): Development and Evaluation of a New Tool for Patients After Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All adult postoperative patients that are inpatients, and scheduled for
             hospitalization for more than 8 hours

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Children, mental illness, communication difficulties

clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Quality for Inpatients After Surgery at the Ward. Development and Evaluation of a New Tool: Efficacy Side-effect Score (ESS)

primary_outcome.description: Information from the patient will be collected systematically, and held together with clinical signs and findings to give the investigators a better understanding of the patient`s postoperative status.
primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Efficacy of postoperative treatment.
